questions.question:
A user is planning to migrate an application workload to the AWS Cloud.
Which control becomes the responsibility of AWS once the migration is complete?

options.text: Protecting communications and maintaining zone security

questions.explanation: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, AWS is responsible for the physical security of data centers, including physical and environmental controls. The customer remains responsible for the guest operating system and applications.

questions.question: Which services can be used to deploy applications on AWS? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: AWS Elastic Beanstalk and AWS OpsWorks are used to deploy applications. AWS Config manages configurations, Application Discovery Service analyzes existing environments, and Amazon Kinesis is used for data streaming.

questions.question: Which AWS service can be used to provide an on-demand, cloud-based contact center?
questions.explanation: Amazon Connect is a fully managed cloud-based contact center service that allows companies to quickly set up and operate call centers.

questions.question: What tool enables customers without an AWS account to estimate costs for almost all AWS services?
questions.explanation: AWS Pricing Calculator allows customers to estimate costs for most AWS services without needing an AWS account.

questions.question: Which component must be attached to a VPC to enable inbound Internet access?
questions.explanation: An internet gateway is required to allow inbound and outbound internet traffic between a VPC and the public internet.

questions.question: Which pricing model would result in maximum Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) savings for a database server that must be online for one year?
questions.explanation: Partial Upfront Reserved Instances provide the greatest savings for stable workloads that must run continuously for one year.

questions.question:
A company has a MySQL database running on a single Amazon EC2 instance. The company now requires higher availability in the event of an outage.
Which set of tasks would meet this requirement?

options.text: Add an Application Load Balancer in front of the EC2 instance
Configure EC2 Auto Recovery to move the instance to another Availability Zone
Migrate to Amazon RDS and enable Multi-AZ
Enable termination protection for the EC2 instance to avoid outages

questions.explanation: Amazon RDS with Multi-AZ provides high availability by automatically replicating data to a standby instance in another Availability Zone and performing automatic failover.

questions.question:
A company wants to ensure that AWS Management Console users are meeting password complexity requirements.
How can the company configure password complexity?

options.text: Using an AWS IAM user policy
Using an AWS Organizations service control policy (SCP)
Using an AWS IAM account password policy
Using an AWS Security Hub managed insight

questions.explanation: An IAM account password policy defines password complexity requirements such as minimum length, character types, and expiration.

questions.question: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, which of the following is the customer's responsibility?

options.text: Patching and fixing flaws in the infrastructure

questions.explanation: Customers are responsible for patching the guest operating system and applications running on AWS infrastructure.

questions.question: Which of the following tasks is required to deploy a PCI-compliant workload on AWS?

options.text: Use any AWS service and implement PCI controls at the application layer
Use an AWS service that is in-scope for PCI compliance and raise an AWS support ticket to enable PCI compliance at the application layer
Use any AWS service and raise an AWS support ticket to enable PCI compliance on that service
Use an AWS service that is in scope for PCI compliance and apply PCI controls at the application layer

questions.explanation: To meet PCI compliance requirements, customers must use AWS services that are in scope for PCI and apply PCI controls at the application layer.

questions.question:
A company is building an application that requires the ability to send, store, and receive messages between application components. The company has another requirement to process messages in first-in, first-out (FIFO) order.
Which AWS service should the company use?
questions.explanation: Amazon SQS enables sending, storing, and receiving messages between application components and supports FIFO queues to preserve message order.

questions.question:
AnyCompany recently purchased Example Corp. Both companies use AWS resources, and AnyCompany wants a single aggregated bill.
Which option allows AnyCompany to receive a single bill?

options.text: Example Corp. must submit a request to its AWS solutions architect or AWS technical account manager to link the accounts and consolidate billing.
AnyCompany must create a new support case in the AWS Support Center requesting that both bills be combined.
Send an invitation to join the organization from AnyCompany's AWS Organizations master account to Example Corp.
Migrate the Example Corp. VPCs, Amazon EC2 instances, and other resources into the AnyCompany AWS account.

questions.explanation: AWS Organizations allows consolidated billing by sending an invitation from the management account to another AWS account.

questions.question: Which tool can be used to create alerts when the actual or forecasted cost of AWS services exceeds a certain threshold?
questions.explanation: AWS Budgets allows customers to create alerts based on actual or forecasted costs when thresholds are exceeded.

questions.question:
A user has limited knowledge of AWS services, but wants to quickly deploy a scalable Node.js application in the AWS Cloud.
Which service should be used to deploy the application?
questions.explanation: AWS Elastic Beanstalk allows users to quickly deploy applications without deep infrastructure knowledge by automatically handling scaling and availability.

questions.question: Which AWS Trusted Advisor check is available to all AWS users?
questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor core checks are available to all AWS customers, even without a paid support plan.

questions.question:
A web developer is concerned that a DDoS attack could target an application.
Which AWS services or features can help protect against such an attack? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: AWS Shield protects against DDoS attacks, and Amazon CloudFront helps absorb and mitigate malicious traffic using edge locations.

questions.question: Which AWS service gives users on-demand, self-service access to AWS compliance control reports?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact provides on-demand access to AWS compliance reports and certifications.

questions.question:
A company wants to provide one of its employees with access to Amazon RDS. The company also wants to limit the interaction to only the AWS CLI and AWS software development kits (SDKs).
Which combination of actions should the company take to meet these requirements while following the principles of least privilege? (Choose two.)

options.text: Create an IAM user and provide AWS Management Console access only.
Create an IAM user and provide programmatic access only.
Create an IAM role and provide AWS Management Console access only.
Create an IAM policy with administrator access and attach it to the IAM user.
Create an IAM policy with Amazon RDS access and attach it to the IAM user.

questions.explanation: Programmatic access is achieved by creating an IAM user with access keys and attaching a policy that grants limited Amazon RDS permissions.

questions.question:
A company has a compliance requirement to record and evaluate configuration changes, as well as perform remediation actions on AWS resources.
Which AWS service should the company use?
questions.explanation: AWS Config records configuration changes, evaluates compliance, and can trigger remediation actions.

questions.question: What are the advantages of deploying an application with Amazon EC2 instances in multiple Availability Zones? (Choose two.)

options.text: Preventing a single point of failure
Reducing the operational costs of the application
Allowing the application to serve cross-region users with low latency
Increasing the availability of the application
Increasing the load of the application

questions.explanation: Deploying instances across multiple Availability Zones eliminates single points of failure and increases application availability.

questions.question:
A workload on AWS will run for the foreseeable future by using a consistent number of Amazon EC2 instances.
What pricing model will minimize cost while ensuring that compute resources remain available?
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances offer the lowest cost for predictable, long-term workloads that run continuously.

questions.question: Which tool can be used to identify scheduled changes to the AWS infrastructure?
questions.explanation: AWS Personal Health Dashboard provides alerts about scheduled changes and issues that may affect specific AWS resources.

questions.question: Which of the following is the customer's responsibility when using Amazon RDS?

options.text: Patching the operating system of underlying hardware
Controlling traffic to and from the database through security groups
Running backups that enable point-in-time recovery of a DB instance

questions.explanation: Customers control access to Amazon RDS using security groups, while AWS manages the operating system and backups.

questions.question: What is the customer's responsibility when using AWS Lambda?
questions.explanation: When using AWS Lambda, customers are responsible for application logic and management, while AWS manages the underlying infrastructure.

questions.question:
A company wants to be notified when its AWS Cloud costs or usage exceed defined thresholds.
Which AWS service will support these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Budgets notifies customers when costs or usage exceed defined thresholds.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides the ability to host a NoSQL database in the AWS Cloud?
questions.explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service designed for high scalability and low latency.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows customers to purchase unused Amazon EC2 capacity at an often discounted rate?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances allow customers to purchase unused EC2 capacity at a significantly reduced price.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature requires an internet service provider (ISP) and a colocation facility to be implemented?
questions.explanation: AWS Direct Connect requires an internet service provider and a colocation facility to establish a dedicated private connection.

questions.question: Which AWS services offer compute capabilities? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 and AWS Lambda provide compute capacity, while Amazon S3 and Amazon EBS are storage services.

questions.question: Which AWS service can be used to privately store and manage versions of source code?
questions.explanation: AWS CodeCommit is a fully managed source control service that securely hosts private Git repositories.

questions.question: Which AWS service should a cloud practitioner use to identify security vulnerabilities of an AWS account?
questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor helps identify security vulnerabilities and deviations from best practices within an AWS account.

questions.question:
A company wants to ensure its infrastructure is designed for fault tolerance and business continuity in the event of an environmental disruption.
Which AWS infrastructure component should the company replicate across?
questions.explanation: Replicating resources across multiple Availability Zones protects applications from single data center failures.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature is used to send both text and email messages from distributed applications?
questions.explanation: Amazon SNS allows distributed applications to send both email and SMS notifications.

questions.question: Which AWS Cloud design principles can help increase reliability? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Testing recovery procedures and enabling automatic recovery from failures are key principles for improving reliability.

questions.question:
A company is planning to launch an ecommerce site in a single AWS Region to a worldwide user base.
Which AWS services will allow the company to reach users and provide low latency and high transfer speeds? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: AWS Global Accelerator and Amazon CloudFront enable global content delivery with low latency and high transfer speeds.

questions.question:
A company wants to connect to AWS over a private, low-latency connection from its remote office.
What is the recommended method to meet these requirements?

options.text: Use VPC peering to create a connection.

questions.explanation: AWS Direct Connect provides a private, low-latency, and highly reliable network connection to AWS.

questions.question: Which AWS service can be used to retrieve compliance reports on demand?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact allows customers to retrieve compliance reports and regulatory documents on demand.

questions.question:
A company has an AWS-hosted website located behind an Application Load Balancer. The company wants to safeguard the website from SQL injection or cross-site scripting.
Which AWS service should the company use?
questions.explanation: AWS WAF protects web applications from common attacks such as SQL injection and cross-site scripting.

questions.question: How should a web application be deployed to ensure high availability in the AWS Cloud?

options.text: Deploy multiple instances of the application in multiple Availability Zones.
Deploy multiple instances of the application in a single Availability Zone.
Deploy the application to a compute-optimized Amazon EC2 instance in a single Availability Zone.
Deploy the application in one Amazon EC2 instance in an Auto Scaling group.

questions.explanation: Deploying multiple instances across multiple Availability Zones ensures high availability and fault tolerance.

questions.question:
A company is running a self-managed Oracle database directly on Amazon EC2 for its steady-state database. The company wants to reduce compute costs.
Which option should the company use to maximize savings over a 3-year term?
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances provide the greatest cost savings for steady-state databases running over multiple years.

questions.question:
An external auditor has requested that a company provide a list of all its IAM users, including the status of users' credentials and access keys.
What it the SIMPLEST way to provide this information?

options.text: Create an IAM user account for the auditor, granting the auditor administrator permissions.
Take a screenshot of each user's page in the AWS Management Console, then provide the screenshots to the auditor.
Download the IAM credential report, then provide the report to the auditor.
Download the AWS Trusted Advisor report, then provide the report to the auditor.

questions.explanation: The IAM credential report provides a complete view of IAM users, passwords, and access key status.

questions.question: What are the benefits of consolidated billing for AWS Cloud services? (Choose two.)

options.text: A minimal additional fee for use
Custom cost and usage budget creation

questions.explanation: Consolidated billing provides a single bill for multiple accounts and enables volume discounts.

questions.question:
A company is expecting a short-term spike in internet traffic for its application. During the traffic increase, the application cannot be interrupted. The company also needs to minimize cost and maximize flexibility.
Which Amazon EC2 instance type should the company use to meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: On-Demand Instances are ideal for short-term traffic spikes when interruptions are not acceptable.

questions.question:
A company wants to track AWS resource configuration changes for compliance reasons.
Which AWS feature can be used to meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: AWS Config rules allow organizations to monitor and evaluate resource configuration changes for compliance.

questions.question:
A company is building an application that needs to deliver images and videos globally with minimal latency.
Which approach can the company use to accomplish this in a cost effective manner?

options.text: Deliver the content through Amazon CloudFront.
Store the content on Amazon S3 and enable S3 cross-region replication.
Implement a VPN across multiple AWS Regions.
Deliver the content through AWS PrivateLink.

questions.explanation: Amazon CloudFront delivers content from locations close to users, reducing latency and improving performance.

questions.question: The AWS IAM best practice for granting least privilege is to:

options.text: apply an IAM policy to an IAM group and limit the size of the group.
require multi-factor authentication (MFA) for all IAM users.
require each IAM user who has different permissions to have multiple passwords.
apply an IAM policy only to IAM users who require it.

questions.explanation: The principle of least privilege means IAM policies should be applied only to users who require those permissions.

questions.question: Which cloud computing benefit does AWS demonstrate with its ability to offer lower variable costs as a result of high purchase volumes?
questions.explanation: Economies of scale allow AWS to offer lower variable costs due to large-scale purchasing.

questions.question:
A pharmaceutical company operates its infrastructure in a single AWS Region. The company has thousands of VPCs in a various AWS accounts that it wants to interconnect.
Which AWS service or feature should the company use to help simplify management and reduce operational costs?
questions.explanation: AWS Transit Gateway simplifies connectivity across thousands of VPCs and reduces operational complexity.

questions.question: How can AWS enable a company to control expenses as an application's usage changes unpredictably?

options.text: AWS will refund the cost difference if a customer moves to larger servers.
The application can be built to scale up or down automatically as resources are needed
Spot instances will automatically be used if the price is lower than on-demand instances.
Amazon CloudWatch will automatically predict what resources are needed.

questions.explanation: Automatic scaling allows AWS customers to control costs as application demand changes unpredictably.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature can be used to prevent SQL injection attacks?
questions.explanation: AWS WAF inspects and filters web requests to block attacks such as SQL injection.
